availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: George Minot Lane (Detroit, Michigan, student, upholsterer, and soldier)

body.p: Detroit, Michigan, student, upholsterer, and soldier. Michigan native. Son of M. T. Lane and Ruth F. Lane. Married to Mary Lane. Father of Florence Lane and Mary L. Lane. Graduate from the University of Michigan, in Ann Arbor, Michigan, in 1853. Upholsterer in Detroit in 1860. Served in the 1st Michigan Engineers and Mechanics (U.S.A.) as a captain. Served in the Invalid Corps (U.S.A.) as captain from June 15, 1863 to January 12, 1864. Served in the 17th Regiment Veteran Reserve Corps (U.S.A.) as a captain and brevet major from January 12, 1864 to April 23, 1866.

ab.bibl:

_Official Army Register of the Volunteer Force of the United States Army for the Years 1861-65, Vol. VIII (Washington D.C., 1867), 58.
The University Palladium Vol. Vi, No. 1, (Ann Arbor: The Secret Societies, 1864), 8.
